title: 235+ “I Love You” Quotes For Your Husband

steps.title: Send a sweet and simple love quote to make your husband smile.
steps.content: Send a sweet and simple love quote to make your husband smile. Whether you’re writing a love letter or shooting a quick text, sending a short love quote is one of the best ways to say “I love you.” Share the words of a world-renowned writer, poet, or philosopher to surprise your husband and make his entire day: “I believe in us.” —Bianca Sparacino “You had me at hello.” — Jerry Maguire “My heart is and always will be yours.” —Jane Austen “Where there is love, there is life.” —Mahatma Gandhi “I look at you and a sense of wonder takes me.” —Homer “My love is selfish. I cannot breathe without you.” —John Keats “I love you down to your every quirk and flaw.” —Mélanie Berliet “I never want to stop making memories with you.” —Pierre Jeanty “I am in you and you in me, mutual in divine love.” —William Blake “Grow old along with me; The best is yet to be.” —Robert Browning “You are all of my today and all of my tomorrows.” —Leo Christopher “Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.” —Aristotle “To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.” —David Viscott “I love talking to you, even if I have nothing to say.” —Mahmoud Darwish “May this marriage be full of laughter, our every day in paradise.” —Rumi “You are my heart, my life, my one and only thought.” —Arthur Conan Doyle “I love you and that's the beginning and end of everything.” —F. Scott Fitzgerald “You’re something between a dream and a miracle.” —Elizabeth Barret Browning “For all the things my hands have held, the best by far is you.” —Andrew McMahon “Love is passion, obsession, and someone you can’t live without.” —William Parrish

steps.title: Choose an ultra romantic quote to shower your husband with love.
steps.content: Choose an ultra romantic quote to shower your husband with love. If your husband is the man of your dreams, your best friend for life, and the person you can count on no matter what, send him a romantic quote to express your emotions! These options speak straight from the heart and are sure to make him feel fuzzy inside: “I have, for the first time, found what I can truly love. I have found you.” —Charlotte Brontë “So, I love you because the entire universe conspired to help me find you.” —Pablo Coelho “I love thee to the depth and breadth and height my soul can reach.” —Elizabeth Barret Browning “I would rather share one lifetime with you than face all the ages of this world alone.” —J.R.R. Tolkien “I was made and meant to look for you and wait for you and become yours forever.” —Robert Browning “He’s more myself than I am. Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.” —Emily Brontë “I never left you; I never will leave you. While life lasts, and beyond, I am here.” —Marion Zimmer Bradley “I'm with you. No matter what else you have in your head I'm with you and I love you.” —Ernest Hemingway “I belong to you; there is really no other way of expressing it, and that is not strong enough.” —Franz Kafka “I saw that you were perfect, and so I loved you. Then I saw that you were not perfect, and I loved you even more.” —Angelita Lim “I seem to have loved you in numberless forms, numberless times…In life after life, in age after age, forever.” —Rabindranath Tagore “My bounty is as boundless as the sea, my love as deep; the more I give to thee, the more I have, for both are infinite.” —William Shakespeare “It takes great courage to see the world in all its tainted glory, and still to love it. And even more courage to see it in the one you love.” —Oscar Wilde “All my heart is yours, sir: it belongs to you; and with you it would remain, were fate to exile the rest of me from your presence forever.” —Charlotte Brontë “Here’s to all the places we went. And all the places we’ll go. And here’s to me, whispering again and again and again and again: I love you.” —John Green “Maybe love at first sight isn’t what we think it is. Maybe it’s recognizing a soul we loved in a past life and falling in love with them again.” —Kamand Kojouri “The best love is the kind that awakens the soul and makes us reach for more—that plants a fire in our hearts and brings peace to our minds.” —Nicholas Sparks “You are the answer to every prayer I’ve offered. You are a song, a dream, a whisper, and I don’t know how I could have lived without you for as long as I have.” —Nicholas Sparks “For you and for me the highest moment, the keenest joy, is not when our minds dominate but when we lose our minds, and you and I both lose it in the same way, through love.” —Anaïs Nin “I will love you forever; whatever happens. Until I die and after I die, and when I find my way out of the land of the dead, I’ll drift about forever, all my atoms, until I find you again.” —Philip Pullman

steps.title: Opt for a cute love quote to express your affection in a subtle way.
steps.content: Opt for a cute love quote to express your affection in a subtle way. If your husband isn’t the type of guy who enjoys lovey dovey messages, stick to a lighthearted quote that isn’t too heavy. These cute love quotes will make his heart flutter and make for the perfect mid-day surprise text: “Love is quivering happiness.” —Khalil Gibran “Loved you yesterday, love you still, always have, always will.” —Elaine Davis “To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.” —Mark Twain “The very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone.” —Jane Austen “Meeting you has been the best thing that’s ever happened to me.” —Nicholas Sparks “I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once.” —John Green “They invented hugs to let people know you love them without saying anything.” —Bil Keane “Love doesn't make the world go round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.” —Franklin P. Jones “I would have really liked just doing laundry and taxes with you.” — Everything Everywhere All At Once “She knew she loved him when 'home' went from being a place to being a person.” —E. Leventhal “How is it that after all these years apart I still think of you every single day?” —Samuel Decker Thompson “Intimacy is the capacity to be rather weird with someone—and finding that that’s ok with them.” —Alain de Botton “You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams.” —Dr. Seuss “Each day, I love you more. Today more than yesterday and less than tomorrow.” —Rosemonde Gerard “I love that you are my person and I am yours, that whatever door we come to, we will open it together.” —A.R. Asher “If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day, so I never have to live without you.” —A.A. Milne “If I had a single flower for every time I think about you, I could walk in my garden forever.” —Claudia Adrienne Grandi “Every day I discover that I love you even more, and in this infinite universe I will love you 'til the ends.” —Alicia N. Green “The secret of a happy marriage is finding the right person. You know they're right if you love to be with them all the time.” —Julia Child “The real lover is the man who can thrill you by kissing your forehead or smiling into your eyes or just staring into space.” —Marilyn Monroe “We're all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love.” —Robert Fulghum

steps.title: Stress how much you love your husband with a longer message.
steps.content: Stress how much you love your husband with a longer message. If you really want to express the true depths of your emotions, choose a love quote that’s lengthier than the other options in this article. These heartfelt paragraphs are perfect to include in your wedding vows, a romantic card or letter, or any other medium you choose to show your affection: “Innumerable words reminded her of him. To link whatever she saw and heard with her love was nothing less than to be alive. Her awareness of her body was inseparable from her memory of his embrace.” —Yasunari Kawabata “It is three at night. I have something to say. You are so valuable. You shine out. You are a magic star. You are a body of blood made beautiful. How I admire, sit back and adore you. How thirsty I am for that. How you feed me.” —Anne Sexton “When you loved me I gave you the whole sun and stars to play with. I gave you eternity in a single moment, strength of the mountains in one clasp of your arms, and the volume of all the seas in one impulse of your soul.” —George Bernard Shaw “Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.” —Ann Landers “Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I’m gazing at a distant star. It’s dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago. Maybe the star doesn’t even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything.” —Haruki Murakami “I don’t know when we’ll see each other again or what the world will be like when we do. We may both have seen many horrible things. But I will think of you every time I need to be reminded that there is beauty and goodness in the world.” —Arthur Golden “People think a soulmate is your perfect fit, and that's what everyone wants. But a true soulmate is a mirror, the person who shows you everything that is holding you back, the person who brings you to your own attention so you can change your life.” —Elizabeth Gilbert “They loved each other, not driven by necessity, by the “blaze of passion” often falsely ascribed to love. They loved each other because everything around them willed it, the trees and the clouds and the sky over their heads and the hearth under their feet.” —Boris Pasternak “When your beauty struck me, it dissolved me. Deep down, I am not different from you. I dreamed you, I wished for your existence. I see in you that part of me which is you. I surrender my sincerity because if I love you it means we share the same fantasies, we share the same madness.” —Anaïs Nin “I’m in love with you, and I know that love is just a shout into the void, and that oblivion is inevitable, and that we’re all doomed and that there will come a day when all our labor has been returned to dust, and I know the sun will swallow the only earth we’ll ever have, and I am in love with you.” —John Green “I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close.” —Pablo Neruda “If there is no love in the world, we will make a new world, and we will give it walls, and we will furnish it with soft, red interiors, from the inside out, and give it a knocker that resonates like a diamond falling to a jeweler’s felt so that we should never hear it. Love me, because love doesn’t exist, and I have tried everything that does.” —Jonathan Safran Foer “When we hold each other, in the darkness, it doesn’t make the darkness go away. The bad things are still out there. The nightmares still walking. When we hold each other we feel not safe, but better. “It’s all right” we whisper, “I’m here, I love you.” and we lie: “I’ll never leave you.” For just a moment or two the darkness doesn’t seem so bad.” —Neil Gaiman “I can’t think of any greater happiness than to be with you all the time, without interruption, endlessly, even though I feel that here in this world there’s no undisturbed place for our love, neither in the village nor anywhere else; and I dream of a grave, deep and narrow, where we could clasp each other in our arms as with clamps, and I would hide my face in you and you would hide your face in me, and nobody would ever see us any more.” —Franz Kafka

steps.title: Thank your husband for lifting you up and loving you unconditionally.
steps.content: Thank your husband for lifting you up and loving you unconditionally. According to licensed psychologist Sarah Schewitz, PsyD, “men, more than anything, want to be appreciated for what they do.” Being specific about how your husband has supported you is one of the best ways to express your love and make him feel valued. So, choose a quote that highlights everything he’s done for you, whether it’s offering a shoulder to cry on or teaching you how to love yourself. “I am who I am because of you.” —Nicholas Sparks “Thank you for loving me, flaws and all.” —Unknown “I appreciate you…especially your heart.” —Unknown “If I know what love is, it is because of you.” —Hermann Hesse “Thank you for always being my rainbow after the storm.” —Unknown "I would not wish any companion in the world but you." —William Shakespeare “I love you not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you.” —Elizabeth Barrett Browning “Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength while loving someone deeply gives you courage.” —Lao Tzu “In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours. In all the world, there is no love for you like mine.” —Maya Angelou “I love your feet because they have wandered over the earth and through the wind and water until they brought you to me.” —Pablo Neruda “You have influenced my life in such a positive way words cannot express my appreciation. You are truly an inspiration.” —Catherine Pulsipher “Some people arrive and make such a beautiful impact on your life, you can barely remember what life was like without them.” —Anna Taylor “She loved him because he had brought her back to life. She had been like a caterpillar in a cocoon, and he had drawn her out and shown her that she was a butterfly.” —Ken Follett “I appreciate you more because of the road I’ve traveled. My story brought me to you and I wouldn’t revise a word of my past if it led me anywhere but to your door.” —Aaron Polson “You changed my life without even trying, and I don't think I could ever tell you how much you mean to me. I can't imagine what things would be like if I hadn't met you.” —Steve Maraboli “Do you remember what you said to me once? That you could help me only by loving me? Well–you did love me for a moment; and it helped me. It has always helped me.” —Edith Wharton “I wasn't expecting you. I didn't think that we would end up together. The single most extraordinary thing I've ever done with my life is fall in love with you. I've never been so completely, loved so passionately and protected so fiercely.” — This Is Us

steps.title: Reassure your husband that you’ll always be there for him.
steps.content: Reassure your husband that you’ll always be there for him. Support is one of the core pillars for a healthy relationship because it increases intimacy, builds trust, and allows both partners to feel comfortable sharing their thoughts and emotions. [1] X Research source Part of loving your husband is supporting him through thick and thin, so send a love quote that echoes this sentiment and makes him feel unstoppable: “The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.” —Audrey Hepburn “Never above you. Never below you. Always beside you.” —Walter Winchell “When you love someone unconditionally, you accept them for who they are, flaws and all.” —Brené Brown “Remember, we all stumble, every one of us. That’s why it’s a comfort to go hand in hand.” —Emily Kimbrough “I can't promise to fix all your problems, but I can promise you won't have to face them all alone.” —Unknown “We come to love not by finding a perfect person, but by learning to see an imperfect person perfectly.” —Sam Keen “Being married is like having somebody permanently in your corner. It feels limitless, not limited.” —Gloria Steinem “A good relationship is when someone accepts your past, supports your present, and encourages your future.” —Unknown “A good marriage is one which allows for change and growth in the individuals and in the way they express their love.” —Pearl S. Buck “In the end, there doesn't have to be anyone who understands you. There just has to be someone who wants to.” —Robert Brault “Maybe the only vow we ever need to offer the one we love is this: I will never, not for a sliver of a second, make you feel alone.” —Tyler Knott Gregson “A great marriage is not when the ‘perfect couple’ comes together. It is when an imperfect couple learns to enjoy their differences.” —Dave Meurer “I’ve never had a moment’s doubt in my entire existence. I love you. I believe in you completely. You are my dearest one. My reason for life.” —Ian McEwan “The greatest marriages are built on teamwork. A mutual respect, a healthy dose of admiration, and a never-ending portion of love and grace.” —Fawn Weaver “If I could give you one thing in life, I would give you the ability to see yourself through my eyes, only then would you realize how special you are to me.” —Unknown “The purpose of a relationship is not to have another who might complete you, but to have another with whom you might share your completeness.” —Neale Donald Walsch “Come, let’s be a comfortable couple and take care of each other! How glad we shall be, that we have somebody we are fond of always, to talk to and sit with.” —Charles Dickens “I look at you and see all the ways a soul can bruise, and I wish I could sink my hands into your flesh and light lanterns along your spine so you know there's nothing but light when I see you.” —Shinji Moon “Listen to me, Mister. You're my knight in shining armor. Don't you forget it. You're going to get back on that horse, and I'm going to be right behind you, holding on tight, and away we're gonna go, go go!” — On Golden Pond

steps.title: Stick to an inspirational love quote when stressful times strike.
steps.content: Stick to an inspirational love quote when stressful times strike. If you’re going through a rough patch in your relationship, it’s important to rediscover intimacy, remember the good times, and switch things up. [2] X Research source Send an inspirational quote about love to remind your husband that you’ll always be by his side, and stand by your commitment to love him in sickness and in health. “The first duty of love is to listen.” —Paul Tillich “Life is the flower for which love is the honey.” —Victor Hugo “Love does not dominate; it cultivates.” —Johann Wolfgang von Goethe “Love must be as much as light as it is a flame.” —Henry David Thoreau “Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind.” —William Shakespeare “Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.” —Voltaire “One word frees us of all the weight and pain in life. That word is love!” —Sophocles “’Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.” —Alfred Tennyson “To love and be loved is the most natural expression of our being.” —Deepak Chopra “To love is nothing. To be loved is something. But to love and be loved, that’s everything.” —T. Tolis “Rules for happiness: something to do, someone to love, something to hope for.” —Immanuel Kant “There is no love without forgiveness, and there is no forgiveness without love.” —Bryant H. McGill “Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.” —Robert A. Heinlein “There is always madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.” —Friedrich Nietzsche “I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love.” —Mother Teresa “Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone—we find it with another.” —Thomas Merton “Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.” —Dalai Lama XIV “Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.” —Morihei Ueshiba “The source of love is deep in us and we can help others realize a lot of happiness. One word, one action, one thought can reduce another person's suffering and bring that person joy.” —Thich Nhat Hanh “The more one does and sees and feels, the more one is able to do, and the more genuine may be one's appreciation of fundamental things like home, and love, and understanding companionship.” —Amelia Earhart

steps.title: Crank up the heat with these sensual and flirty love quotes.
steps.content: Crank up the heat with these sensual and flirty love quotes. If you want to make your husband feel desired , surprise him with any of these sexy love quotes. It’s an easy way to get him in the mood, keep him on his toes, and rekindle the spark in your marriage . “I wanna be on you.” — Anchorman “You can have me anywhere.” — Casino Royale “Bite marks are love notes written on flesh.” — Unknown “I’d like to destroy you a few times in bed.” —Ernest Hemingway “A sea of whisky couldn’t intoxicate me as a drop of you.” —J.S. Parker “He was now in that state of fire that she loved. She wanted to be burnt.” —Anaïs Nin “Some of the best moments in life are the ones you can't tell anyone about.” —Sarah Nader “The sexual embrace can only be compared with music and with prayer.” —Marcus Aurelius “A gentleman holds my hand. A man pulls my hair. A soulmate will do both.” —Alessandra Torre “I gasp, and I'm Eve in the Garden of Eden, and he's the serpent, and I cannot resist.” —E.L. James “The true feeling of sex is that of a deep intimacy, but above all of a deep complicity.” — James Dickey “My heart beats faster as you take my hand. My love grows stronger as you touch my soul.” —A.C. Van Cherub “Graze on my lips, and if those hills be dry, stray lower, where the pleasant fountains lie.” —William Shakespeare “I had to touch you with my hands, I had to taste you with my tongue; one can’t love and do nothing.” —Graham Greene “The raging fire which urged us on was scorching us; it would have burned us had we failed to restrain it.” —Giacomo Casanova “Let me paint your lips with the stars… so that I don’t need to go light-years each night to kiss them.” —Samba Shiva Thadavarthi “Sensual pleasures have the fleeting brilliance of a comet; a happy marriage has the tranquility of a lovely sunset.” —Ann Landers “I never understood why anyone would have sex on the floor. Until I was with you and I realized: you don’t ever realize you’re on the floor.” ― David Levithan “My soul made love to your soul long before our bodies met. When I first laid my eyes on you, I recognized you. You held my future in your hands.” —Anita Krizzan “Take off your clothes. Show me. Show me your edges. I want to see with my own eyes where you end and where I begin. I want to see where I fit, where you leave off being you and turn into me.” —Peregrine “I desire to be with you. I miss you. I feel lonely when I can't see you. I am obsessed with you, fascinated by you, infatuated with you. I hunger for your taste, your smell, the feel of your soul touching mine.” —Jack Llewellyn

steps.title: Turn to a funny love quote to brighten your husband’s day.
steps.content: Turn to a funny love quote to brighten your husband’s day. Looking to make your husband laugh out loud ? Opt for a funny quote about love and marriage to capture the playful side of your partnership. All of these quotes are extremely witty and relatable, which can help maintain humor at the heart of your marriage: “I am yours. No refunds.” —Anita Bath “Love is being stupid together.” —Paul Valéry “Love is sharing your popcorn.” —Charles Schultz “Come live in my heart and pay no rent.” —Samuel Lover “You can't blame gravity for falling in love.” —Albert Einstein “I love you in a way that’s nauseating to others.” —Dinah Mite “Love is not having to hold in your farts anymore.” —Bree Luckey “I promise to always be by your side. Or under you. Or on top.” —Joe King “Romantic love is a mental illness. But it’s a pleasurable one.” —Fran Lebowitz “Love is telling someone their hair extensions are showing.” —Natasha Leggero “I love you more than coffee. But please don’t make me prove it.” —Gerry Attrick “All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn’t hurt.” —Charles M. Schulz “I love you no matter what you do, but do you have to do so much of it?” —Jean Illsley Clarke “As a man in a relationship, you have a choice: You can be right or you can be happy.” —Ralphie May “Marriage is like vitamins: we supplement each other’s minimum daily requirements.” —Kathy Mohnke “Love, I've come to understand, is more than three words mumbled before bedtime.” —Nicholas Sparks “I want to be the reason you look down at your phone and smile. Then walk into a pole.” —Frank N. Stein “I love being married. It's so great to find one special person you want to annoy for the rest of your life.” —Rita Rudner “I love you. You annoy me more than I ever thought possible. But I want to spend every irritating minute with you.” —Iona Mink “People are weird. When we find someone with weirdness that is compatible with ours, we team up and call it love.” —Dr. Seuss “Every day I fall in love with you more and more. Except yesterday, yesterday you were pretty annoying.” —Earl E. Bird “‘I’ll follow him to the ends of the earth,’ she sobbed. Yes, darling. But the earth doesn’t have any ends. Columbus fixed that.” —Tom Robbins

steps.title: Share a meaningful song lyric if you’re at a loss for words.
steps.content: Share a meaningful song lyric if you’re at a loss for words. If you’re struggling to put your thoughts into words, get help from your favorite band or artist. Sharing a heartfelt lyric is one of the best ways to make your husband feel cared for , especially if you send it with a playlist that reminds you of him or your relationship. “I can’t lose when I’m with you.” —SZA, “Snooze” “To you, I'll give the world.” —Fleetwood Mac, “Songbird” “I’d trade hours for minutes with you.” —Wisp, “See You Soon” “And at every table, I’ll save you a seat.” —Taylor Swift, “Lover” “When I think of you, I don’t feel so alone.” —Owl City, “Vanilla Twilight” “Heaven is not fit to house a love like you and I.” —Hozier, “Francesca” “Heaven is a place on earth with you.” —Lana Del Rey, “Video Games” “The moon, the stars are nothing without you.” —Sam Smith, “Lay Me Down” “Everything means nothing if I ain’t got you.” —Alicia Keys, “If I Ain’t Got You” “When you look me in the eyes and tell me that you love me, everything’s alright.” “I’ll tell you one thing—it’s always better when we’re together.” —Jack Johnson, “Better Together” “If the world was ending, I’d wanna be next to you.” —Lady Gaga & Bruno Mars, “Die With a Smile” “To die by your side is such a heavenly way to die.” —The Smiths, “There Is a Light That Never Goes Out” “At last…my love has come along. My lonely days are over. And life is like a song.” —Etta James, “At Last” “I’m a lover, not a fighter. But if anyone tried to hurt you, I would be ruthless for you.” —Kacey Musgraves, “Ruthless” “Anything’s possible since you made my heart melt. Gave me the best hand that I’d ever been dealt.” —Justin Bieber, “All Around Me” “Hit me like a ray of sun burning through my darkest night. You’re the only one I want. Think I’m addicted to your light.” —Beyoncé, “Halo” “If the sun refused to shine, I would still be loving you. When mountains crumble to the sea, there will still be you and me.” —Led Zeppelin, “Thank You” “I have died everyday, waiting for you. Darling, don’t be afraid, I have loved you for a thousand years. I’ll love you for a thousand more.” —Christina Perry, “A Thousand Years” “It was written that I would love you from the moment I opened my eyes. And the morning when I first saw you gave me life under calico skies.” —Paul McCartney, “Calico Skies” “You need a place to land, I’ll be the floor. If you need an easy out, I’ll be the door. If you need a song to sing, I’ll be the chords. The wind beneath your wings, I’ll be the source.” —Maren Morris, “because, of course”

steps.title: Include a Bible verse to motivate and inspire your husband.
steps.content: Include a Bible verse to motivate and inspire your husband. Whether you’re looking for a quote to include in your wedding ceremony or to write in an anniversary card, there are tons of beautiful scriptures about love, marriage, and commitment. Take the time to select a verse that resonates with your relationship or your husband’s current stage in life. The more personal and thoughtful, the better! “We love because he first loved us.” —1 John 4:19 “Let all that you do be done in love.” —1 Corinthians 16:14 “I am my beloved’s and my beloved is mine.” —Song of Solomon 8:3 “Hatred stirs up conflict, but love covers over all wrongs.” —Proverbs 10:12 “Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.” —Mark 10:9 “If possible, so far as it depends on you, live peaceably with all.” —Romans 12:18 “This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you.” —John 15:12 “Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.” —1 John 4:19 “Above all, keep loving one another earnestly, since love covers a multitude of sins.” —1 Peter 4:8 “I have found the one whom my soul loves. I held him, and would not let him go.” —Song of Solomon 3:4 “And above all these put on love, which binds everything together in perfect harmony.” —Colossians 3:14 “And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.” —1 Corinthians 13:13 “Owe no one anything, except to love each other, for the one who loves another has fulfilled the law.” —Romans 13:8 “Let me hear in the morning of your steadfast love, for in you I trust. Make me know the way I should go, for to you lift up my soul.” —Psalm 143:8 “Bear with each other and forgive one another if any of you has a grievance against someone. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.” —Colossians 3:13 “Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their labor: If either of them falls down, one can help the other up.” —Ecclesiastes 4:9 “Be completely humble and gentle; be patient, bearing with one another in love. Make every effort to keep the unity of the Spirit through the bond of peace.” —Ephesians 4:2-3 “Steadfast love and faithfulness meet; righteousness and peace kiss each other. Faithfulness springs up from the ground, and righteousness looks down from the sky.” —Psalm 85:10-11 “Let love and faithfulness never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart. Then you will win favor and a good name in the sight of God and man.” —Proverbs 3:3-4 “And let us consider how to stir up one another to love and good works, not neglecting to meet together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging one another, and all the more as you see the Day drawing near.” —Hebrews 10:24-25

steps.title: Tell your husband that you miss him deeply if you’re physically apart.
steps.content: Tell your husband that you miss him deeply if you’re physically apart. According to embodied leadership and relationship expert Zach Pontrello, sending an “I miss you” message is “a very powerful way to say that [someone] is important to you.” So, text your husband a thoughtful quote to keep a long-distance relationship alive and let him know you’re counting down the days until you see him in person. “The world is very quiet without you around.” —Lemony Snicket “You happened, and absence never felt so real.” —Perry Poetry “I miss you in waves and tonight I’m drowning.” —Denice Envall “I exist in two places, here and where you are.” —Margaret Atwood “Distance unites missing beats of two hearts in love.” —Munia Khan “Absence sharpens love, presence strengthens it.” —Thomas Fuller “I miss you deeply, unfathomably, senselessly, terribly.” —Franz Kafka “I love you past the moon and miss you beyond the stars.” —J.M. Storm “I miss you in ways that not even words can understand.” —Gemma Troy “Distance means so little when someone means so much.” —Tom McNeal “What is the opposite of two? A lonely me, a lonely you.” —Richard Wilbur “Half of me is missing…and the other half is missing you.” —Ranata Suzuki “If you think missing me is hard, then you should try missing you.” —Theofilos “Trees quiet without the birds, my heart quiets without you.” —Terri Guillemets “In case you ever foolishly forget: I am never not thinking of you.” —Virginia Woolf “The pain of missing you is a beautiful reminder of the joy of loving you.” —Dean Jackson “Sometimes, when one person is missing, the whole world seems depopulated.” —Lamartine “Listen to the sunset; see its pretty hue. When you see it, think of me, and I’ll think of you.” —Oksana Rus “When you are not at hand to kiss away my fears, I cannot choose but be wretched.” —Byron Caldwell Smith “I think we dream so we don’t have to be apart so long. If we’re in each other’s dreams, we can play together all night.” —Bill Watterson “When you miss me, just look up to the night sky and remember, I’m like a star; sometimes, you can’t see me, but I’m always there.” —Jayde Nicole

steps.title: Perform a random act of kindness or a thoughtful gesture to show love.
steps.content: Perform a random act of kindness or a thoughtful gesture to show love. While sending your husband a love quote is a great way to express your affection, there are tons of other things you can do to make him feel loved . Studies show that sharing appreciation can improve your relationship and make you and your husband happier overall. [3] X Research source So, here are some thoughtful acts you can do to show gratitude: Give him a cute or romantic nickname . Encourage him and support his goals and dreams. Praise him in front of other people to boost his ego. Run an errand on his behalf or surprise him with his favorite meal. Dress up for him sometimes to show you still want to impress him. Hug him, hold his hand, kiss him, and cuddle him throughout the day. Leave sticky notes around the house with compliments and loving messages that you love your husband. Give him a gift that aligns with his interests, such as the latest video game or a book he’s been wanting to read. Make a date night jar by writing down different date ideas on index cards, then placing them in a mason jar. Have your husband choose a card every week or month to spice up date night.
